reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing much to say, other than this is an outstanding hotel. No complaints, food excellent, staff excellent, weather excellent, room excellent. What more can be said? Maybe just that it's not suitable for young children, but this is true of Amalfi rather than peculiar to the hotel.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Small Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Go there!!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with breathtaking views & friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from eight nights with children 10 and 8. We had half-board and the meals were excellent, served either indoor or outdoor in a restaurant with the most stunning view of Amalfi. When you see how expensive the area is you realise this hotel is excellent value. The waiters were so friendly and willing to recommend wine - which was all reasonably priced and very enjoyable (a lot were local). They would cook the kids pretty much whatever they wanted (spaghetti of course). Both breakfast and dinner were very good -we managed 4 courses every night. The rooms were very comfortable with air-con so quiet you could leave it on at night.
reviews.title: Amazing views, friendly, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lift took us down to the pool or to the beach which is a platform hewn into the rock with sunbeds from which you can dive straight into the clear blue sea. The pictures don't do it justice.
reviews.title: Great views, great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We had such a great time that our son burst into tears when we left !!
reviews.title: Location, Location, friendly service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our travel agent booked us for the Miramalfi claiming the hotel was a 4 star hotel. When we arrived at the hotel the hotel appeared to be very old and outdated. Since we were going to be out of the hotel during the day, the decor didn't really bother me.
reviews.title: Unbelievably Dirty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff walked us to our room (double w/ ocean view) and after getting settled in and slightly unpacked, I started to notice hairs in the bathroom. There was hair on the bathroom floor, bathroom counter and even in the toilet. I also noticed hair on the floor since the floor was tile. I called down to the front desk who sent someone up to inspect the room and they determined that the room was not cleaned. The staff then assigned us another room, their last one they claimed, in which we once again started to unpack and get settled in. During my visit to the bathroom to unpack my cosmetics, I once again noticed hair in the bathroom. This time there was more hair on the floor and the countertop. I also noticed the bathtub had mold growing around the tub! I decided to accept the room since it was the "last" one and decided to spray everything down with Lysol (thank goodness for Lysol). But after pulling the comforter back, i noticed several (not one or two) but several human hairs from the lower region (or could have been chest hairs). At that time I called down to the front desk who informed me that they should have checked the room but they couldn't assist me anymore than that. I ended up checking out and going to another hotel down the street. I am still trying to get my money refunded from this hotel since their rooms were dirty. I can only assume they only changed the bed sheets and removed the trash from the room and nothing else. Travelers be forewarned!
reviews.title: Wonderful Setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with our extended family in July for 2 weeks. It is a wonderfully relaxing place to stay with amazing views from just about every room in the hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are fairly small and basic (we were in the east wing) and the couple in our party who paid extra for a superior room did not think it was worth it. There are lots of terraces down towards the sea and the pool with ample seating and the most beautiful views out to sea and over Amalfi.
reviews.title: Just perfect

likes.disliked: — Would be good to have internet in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked down to Amalfi every evening for drinks in a little bar and found that the hotel shuttle bus runs at a perfect time for heading back for dinner.
reviews.title: Warmly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with the previous post; the rooms are pretty dated but I have never been to Italy an hung out all day in my hotel room! The views from the room are great; you're right on the water, but the view from the dining room at breakfast makes it hard to leave; I don't think I'd ever get tired of it. Service was cordial. Only stayed here for two nights but no complaints. You can walk into Amalfi by squeezing along the road and it only takes about 10 minutes. Loved Amalfi!
reviews.title: Views are worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view from the rooms is incredible, looking over Amalfi and the harbour to the north. Truly beautiful. We sat happily on the balcony as dusk fell and watched the boats returning to harbour and the lights in the town below coming on.
reviews.title: 5-star views + 2-star rooms = 3.5-star hotel?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's possible to walk to the centre of town in 10 minutes, though with the steps it's 15 minutes to come back and definitely not for the unfit! Otherwise, there's a bus stop directly outside the hotel to get you in to Amalfi, or even further on your way around the coast on the Sita routes.
reviews.title: Beautiful waterfront cliff-side views / good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel room itself was very outdated now, with green wicker furniture and faded pictures on the wall. The television was awful with terrible picture quality - but yes, much better things to look at outside! The bathroom was similarly old, and the complimentary toiletries are a throw back to the 1970s, as photographed, with shampoo in a plastic sachet.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was not at all soundproofed, with noise coming from adjacent rooms above and on both sides - voices, tv/radio sound, water running and flushing, footsteps on tiled floors, and furniture being moved. The external shutters did however provide for total light blackout. The fridge had space for our own items (not the modern automated sort, obviously).
reviews.title: Could not have picked a better place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Small elegant hotel in great location. Fabulous views of water and harbour from balcony. Pool and sea access, just marvellous. Short walk to town, 10 minutes and hotel has shuttle bus. Ferry to Positano and Capri.
reviews.title: Fabulous location,charming hotel, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel with stunning views, great food and helpful staff - especially Gabrielle the barman. The position on a cliff side overlooking Amalfi is fantastic with views from every room. Food every night was excellent value (when you consider the £/euro exhange rate). All in all a great place for a relaxing holiday as well as a base to explore the Amalfi coast, Capri, Pompeii, etc.
reviews.title: Unbeatable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Miramalfi in the last few days of September. Spectacular position, just outside Amalfi (although a relatively easy walk in - or down should I say!). We had a standard double room which had spectacular views across the sea. Breakfast was good, again taken on a terrace high up overlooking the bay. There is also a lovely terrace bar overlooking Amalfi for a pre-dinner drink. All the staff were very helpful, especially the main barman who could not do enough. Great position, great views, good value.
reviews.title: Ticks all the boxes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Unbelieveable views, great restaurant and very friendly restaurant staff. The reception staff werent overally helpful but the rest of the staff were exceptional. Free shuttle to city was very useful and the pool and beach area wonderful.
reviews.title: Fantastic views and large family rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Miramalfi on our honeymoon trip to Amalfi. Views from our room were stunning & the hotel staff were wonderful, especially the barman, Gabrielle, who was absolutely brilliant. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Amalfi where there are numerous restaurants to eat. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Absolutely lovely stay at this hotel.
